author: Coral Barry
title: Sergio Ramos urges Isco to remain at Real Madrid despite continuing transfer talk
text:
Isco has not played as much as he would like for Real Madrid (Picture: Getty) Sergio Ramos has urged Isco to remain at Real Madrid and turn down any offers he may have from other clubs.
Alexis Sanchez gives Chelsea major hope with latest interview on Arsenal future Premier League duo Chelsea and Manchester United are rumoured to be monitoring Isco’s situation while Real’s rivals Barcelona have been linked with a move for the midfielder.
Barcelona were reported to be pressuring Isco to wait out the final months of his contract, but the 24-year-old dismissed those claims as ‘invented’.
And Ramos has insisted his Real team-mate would be crazy to leave the best club in the world.
‘We hope Isco stays,’ Ramos told Deportes Cuatro.
Chelsea and Manchester United have been linked with Isco (Picture: Getty) ‘It’s better to be at Madrid than to go anywhere else.
‘Isco has to look for balance and happiness.
‘He’s taking everything in a calm way, putting everything that’s being said to one side, and from there he can be happy and play good football.’
Isco was back among the goals during the international break (Picture: Getty) More: Football Jose Mourinho speaks out over Man United's interest for 'absurd' £173m superstar

Isco has long been linked with a move to England with talk first beginning when the Spaniard became hot property at Malaga.
Real won the race for his services, but Isco has seen his game time slowly decrease in Madrid.
Isco has just one year left on his current deal and has already admitted his lack of playing time in the big games under Zinedine Zidane concerns him.
